reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Provision of better dignified shelters and winterization assistance to the most vulnerable people in NW Syria (under Envelope 1)

description.narrative:
**Mercy-USA for Aid and Development in this project will support the most vulnerable people in NW Syria in two components:
1-Provision of better dignified shelter solution by piloting innovative shelter approach which comprises steel metal frame and sandwich panels (total shelter unit size21.8 sq. meter) in one camp “AL Hussein” in Idleb sub-district to accommodate 335 HH, 1710 individuals (Men 203- Women 301- Boys 586- Girls 620) with ramp in each shelter unit ensure accessibility for people with disabilities in all shelter units and facilities, privacy, and safety for all vulnerable groups. Gravelling will be provided to the shelter ground with thickness of 15 cm with compaction and humidification for appropriate installation for shelter units Furthermore, Mercy-USA will install 16 special ceramic latrines from the Turkish type with handrails (8 for males and 8 for females) for persons with disability to access the facilities.
Shelter units will be purchased from Turkish Red Crescent (TRC) and will be delivered in packs to Syria. The shelter units will be installed by daily workers using cash for work. On the other hand, infrastructure preparations including gravelling, ramps, PWD latrines and handrails will be done through contractor
2-Cash for winter (150 USD) for each HH one-off during January and February 2022 in Afrin sub-district in addition to new shelter approach beneficiaries in the same camp in Idleb sub-district Total number of beneficiaries who will be targeted will be 2348 HH - 13,618 individuals (Men 1613- Women 2400- Boys 4668- Girls 4937) by using cash modality for implementation as blanket distribution in the targeted IDP site “AL Hussein” while applying selection criteria based on the vulnerability status to select to the most vulnerable in Afrin sub-district.
**Accountability to Affected population (AAP) will be given high priority in this project by communications and sharing information with beneficiaries during all project phases, as well as using complaints and feedback mechanism which is accessible to all beneficiaries especially the most vulnerable such as persons with disabilities, the elderly, women and girls, thus taking corrective actions based on need.
**HLP documents will be given high attention, so all HLP documents for all selected camp should be available to be cleared.
** Furthermore, MEAL plan will be for all project stages such as verification of vulnerability assessment, distribution monitoring, PDM, with using different MEAL tools.
**Reporting will be on timely basis according to the priority, ex., narrative report will be interim and final, while other reports will be on a weekly basis.

owner-org.narrative: United Nations OCHA Financial Tracking Service (UN OCHA FTS)
